pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.5_0: The second training rule on covering the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.15_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their bodies uncovered. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.3.1_0: “‘I will sit well-covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.4_0: One should be well-covered while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area with his body uncovered, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
